column3: In barren fields afar, I sense the stirring of dire foes. Those who wander shall make a stand...and you shall serve as their beacon. I, too, mean to confront this rising threat.
Ere we stride into battle, however, let us steep our souls in song\xe2\x94\x80aye, a performance in your honor...
\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Dawn may banish even the darkest night,\x02\x10\x01\x03Yet ever shall primal desires burn.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03

\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Two swords shall vie to lay them low\xe2\x94\x80\x02\x10\x01\x03A blade born of light and a blade forged of might.\x02\x10\x01\x03Alas, man may entrust his fate unto but one.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
Truly, Archon Louisoix had a gift with words. Had circumstances been different, he would have made a magnificent minstrel...
You desire an encore? Very well, it would be my pleasure.

From an era long forgotten,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03A blade of midnight drawn,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03From a battlefield awakened,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03A warrior who bears the dawn...\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03

From an era long forgotten,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03A blade of midnight drawn,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03From a distant land uncharted,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03A warrior who bears the dawn...\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03
Ever since I first set foot in these lands, I have been haunted by a song.
It foretold the coming of the Seventh Umbral Era, and of those who would deliver us from doom...
Of course, I need not speak to you and yours of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes's words.
For in the fires of Carteneau, you witnessed the truth of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Divine Chronicles\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03...
And when you emerged from the Praetorium triumphant, you proved yourself a Warrior of Light to the world once more.
bx02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Ne'er till land consumes sun can sea bear moons
bx02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Stray seeds quicken in ash's grey embrace
column4: \x02\x10\x01\x03Valiant blades forged under the Twelve's good grace.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03"

column3: The words of the prophetess Mezaya Thousand Eyes as writ in her \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Divine Chronicles\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03.
The \xe2\x80\x9ccrimson flames\xe2\x80\x9d of Dalamud heralded the end of an era...
And the \xe2\x80\x9cvaliant blades\xe2\x80\x9d that were the Warriors of Light brought us hope in our darkest hour.
\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Seven waning moons see seven suns rise,\x02\x10\x01\x03Divine order roils, fallen corpses writhe.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Souls from aether far, strangers from strange lands,\x02\x10\x01\x03Yester with thine eyes, morrow by thine hands.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
We knew not whom the verses spoke of\xe2\x94\x80not I, nor the Archons, nor any other soul in the realm.
The Warriors of Light were lost to us. If not them, who could it be?
And then came the rumors of one not unlike them\xe2\x94\x80a \x02\x08\x0f\xe9\x05\xff\x06woman\xff\x04man\x03 who walked in the light of the Crystal.
From the moment I saw you, I felt it must be true. Having learned of your deeds in their entirety, I now \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03know\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 it to be true.
You are as they were, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03\xe2\x94\x80a Warrior of Light, and an inspiration to us all.
\x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Lances of light herald the dawn,\x02\x10\x01\x03Beckoning shadows deeper still.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03
bx02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Splendor dances with shades\x02\x10\x01\x03Unsheathed
column4: a rime-kissed blade\x02\x10\x01\x03Spills crimson o'er fields of white.\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 "

column3: Archon Louisoix warned us that shadows will accompany the coming of dawn. In answer to ascendant light, darkness will gather in opposition...or so I interpret his words.
What \xe2\x80\x9ca rime-kissed blade\xe2\x80\x9d signifies, I cannot yet fathom. But I have heard that roses of blood are blooming in the white fields of Coerthas, in ever greater profusion.
The Twelve keep and defend you, \x02,\r\xff\x07\x02)\x03\xeb\x02\x03\xff\x02 \x02\x03. What tales you'll have to tell when next we meet!

Into the flesh of darkness go bringers of light,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03for the flame that flickers in Bahamut's tomb.\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03In that cloying black stirs a raven white,\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03clawing blood from a barren womb.\xe2\x99\xaa
What was slain in silver proud did in golden malice rise.\xe2\x99\xaa\x02\x10\x01\x03Metals of infamy and ruin, that every hero must despise.\xe2\x99\xaa
Do these verses ring a bell, perchance? I wrote this song to immortalize your journey into Dalamud's Shadow.

One of my most requested songs, especially in those halls and taverns frequented by adventurers. Oftentimes, I can save my voice in the later verses, for the whole place is on its feet by then, belting out the words by heart...

A touch hyperbolic? Why, 'tis the broad strokes that make a popular ballad! Else we would be singing of mending socks and sitting on cushions, would we not? We shall talk again soon\xe2\x94\x80tell me more tales of derring-do, won't you?
